Certainly! Here are some travel tips for getting around Vilnius easily:

1. Vilnius has an efficient public transportation system, including buses and trolleybuses. You can buy tickets at kiosks, newsstands, or directly from the driver. The Vilnius Card also offers unlimited use of public transportation and discounts on attractions. 2. Walking is a great way to explore Vilnius, especially the Old Town, which is mostly pedestrian-friendly. The city also has a bike-sharing system called Cyclocity, which provides an eco-friendly option for getting around. 3. Taxis are readily available in Vilnius, but it's important to only use licensed taxis to avoid scams. You can use ride-hailing apps such as Bolt or Uber to order a taxi. 4. Vilnius is a relatively small city, so it's easy to explore on foot or on a bicycle. Additionally, many of the city's top attractions are located within walking distance from each other. 5. Finally, if you're traveling to Vilnius during the summer months, don't forget to bring sunscreen and a hat, as the sun can be quite strong in Lithuania. Additionally, during the winter months, it can get quite cold and snowy, so be sure to bring warm clothing and appropriate footwear.
